item.title: On Reinstating Pete Rose
item.dc:creator: Alex
item.description: I’m starting to see rumblings about Pete Rose’s potential reinstatement and a “he’s suffered enough” sentiment. I frankly just don’t get it. There are clear consequences stated for betting on baseball. Every player knows them. Baseball Rule 21 (emphasis mine): Any player, umpire, or club or league official or employee, who shall bet any sum…
item.content:encoded:
I’m starting to see rumblings about Pete Rose’s potential reinstatement and a “he’s suffered enough” sentiment. I frankly just don’t get it. There are clear consequences stated for betting on baseball. Every player knows them.

Baseball Rule 21 (emphasis mine):

Any player, umpire, or club or league official or employee, who shall bet any sum whatsoever upon any baseball game in connection with which the bettor has no duty to perform, shall be declared ineligible for one year,” the rule states. “Any player, umpire, or club or league official or employee, who shall bet any sum whatsoever upon any baseball game in connection with which the bettor has a duty to perform shall be declared permanently ineligible.

Permanent means permanent. Period. You don’t like the rules, don’t play the game.

I guess I was due for another rant on this.

item.title: Golf USGA dubs Pinehurst redo ‘awesome’
item.dc:creator: Alex
item.description:
Sandy areas have replaced thick rough off the fairways. They are partially covered with that Pinehurst Resort officials refer to as “natural vegetation,” but what most anyone else would simply call weeds. The edges of the bunkers are ragged. The turf is uneven just off some of the greens, with patches of no grass. Instead…

#
item.content:encoded:
Sandy areas have replaced thick rough off the fairways. They are partially covered with that Pinehurst Resort officials refer to as “natural vegetation,” but what most anyone else would simply call weeds.

The edges of the bunkers are ragged. The turf is uneven just off some of the greens, with patches of no grass.

Instead of verdant fairways from tee-to-green, the fairways are a blend of green, yellow and brown.

That was the plan all along.

This weekend’s US Open should be fascinating.

#

item.title: What We’ve Seen Lately
item.dc:creator: Alex
item.description:
What I’m not saying is that the Mariners have one of the league’s best offensive units. What I am saying is that the Mariners have recently had one of the league’s best offensive units, and we just haven’t seen that from them in god-damned forever. So it’s a different feeling, a new feeling, a fresh…

#
item.content:encoded:
What I’m not saying is that the Mariners have one of the league’s best offensive units. What I am saying is that the Mariners have recently had one of the league’s best offensive units, and we just haven’t seen that from them in god-damned forever. So it’s a different feeling, a new feeling, a fresh feeling, where we get to watch these Mariners and separate them from the Mariners of months and seasons past. It’s re-energizing, because we’ve been able to feel like we’re fans of a whole different ballclub.

It’s been hard watching the Mariners rebuild for years and years and years now, with seemingly good moves and signings (Adrian Beltre anyone) falling flat while players that were passed on in the draft or let go are thriving (Tim Lincecum, Adam Jones).

I’d love to see them competitive again while King Felix is still in his prime.

#

item.title: 2012 Ryder Cup
item.dc:creator: Alex
item.description: This year’s Ryder Cup has been some of the most exciting golf I’ve seen in ages; really great play on both sides. Sorry that I’ll miss many of the singles matches tomorrow, but I’d rather play than watch and I have a morning tee time. The iPhone app is great, I will probably keep my…
item.content:encoded:
This year’s Ryder Cup has been some of the most exciting golf I’ve seen in ages; really great play on both sides. Sorry that I’ll miss many of the singles matches tomorrow, but I’d rather play than watch and I have a morning tee time.

The iPhone app is great, I will probably keep my foursome up to speed with that while on the course.

item.title: NFL Playoff Attrition, Round 2
item.dc:creator: Alex
item.description: Last year I made some SWAGs about which NFL teams that made the playoffs in 2010 would miss in the 2011 season. Recapping those predictions here. Atlanta Baltimore Chicago Green Bay Indianapolis Kansas City New England New Orleans NY Jets Philadelphia Pittsburgh Seattle italic = predicted to miss the playoffs bold = did miss the…
item.content:encoded:
Last year I made some SWAGs about which NFL teams that made the playoffs in 2010 would miss in the 2011 season.

Recapping those predictions here.

  • Atlanta
  • Baltimore
  • Chicago
  • Green Bay
  • Indianapolis
  • Kansas City
  • New England
  • New Orleans
  • NY Jets
  • Philadelphia
  • Pittsburgh
  • Seattle

italic = predicted to miss the playoffs
bold = did miss the playoffs

4/5 correct – not too shabby. I should have gone with my hunch to exclude Philly instead of picking between the Ravens and Steelers. Also, the general statement that half the teams turn over year to year held true.

We’re a week into the season so it’s not quite as blind/pure as last year’s predictions, but let’s make some guesses for 2012. I forced myself to pick 6 this year instead of the 5 I did last year.

  • Atlanta
  • Baltimore
  • Cincinatti
  • Denver
  • Detroit
  • Green Bay
  • Houston
  • New England
  • New Orleans
  • New York
  • Pittsburgh
  • San Francisco

italic = predicted to miss the playoffs

If I didn’t live in Denver and/or hadn’t seen Peyton Manning in week 1, I probably would have picked Denver to miss the playoffs. As it is, I chose the defending Super Bowl champion Giants and Atlanta – both look like good teams. I look forward to seeing which teams make me look foolish next year.

This post is part of the thread: NFL Playoff Predictions – an ongoing story on this site. View the thread timeline for more context on this post.

item.title: GameTonight (for 16 Metros)
item.dc:creator: Alex
item.description: It’s baseball season again, and in downtown Denver that means traffic and bad cell phone connections. We can’t do much about the latter, but be sure to use GameTonight for warning about potential traffic concerns. GameTonight is a single-serving site that answers “is there a game tonight?” and tracks the major sports teams in 1516…
item.content:encoded:
It’s baseball season again, and in downtown Denver that means traffic and bad cell phone connections. We can’t do much about the latter, but be sure to use GameTonight for warning about potential traffic concerns.

GameTonight is a single-serving site that answers “is there a game tonight?” and tracks the major sports teams in 1516 metro areas:

  • Atlanta
  • Bay Area
  • Boston
  • Chicago
  • Cincinnati
  • Dallas
  • Denver
  • Los Angeles
  • Minneapolis
  • Oakland
  • Philadelphia
  • Phoenix
  • San Francisco
  • San Jose
  • Seattle
  • Washington DC

If you live in one of these areas, check it out.

This post is part of the project: GameTonight?. View the project timeline for more context on this post.

item.title: NFL Playoff Attrition
item.dc:creator: Alex
item.description: Every year about half of the teams that make the playoffs in the NFL fail to get back there the following year. Here are the teams from the last few years. Who do you think will fall out of the playoffs from last year’s batch? 2008 7 of 12 teams (bold) failed to make the…
item.content:encoded:
Every year about half of the teams that make the playoffs in the NFL fail to get back there the following year. Here are the teams from the last few years. Who do you think will fall out of the playoffs from last year’s batch?

2008

7 of 12 teams (bold) failed to make the playoffs the next season.

  • Dallas
  • Green Bay
  • Indianapolis
  • Jacksonville
  • New England
  • NY Giants
  • Pittsburgh
  • San Diego
  • Seattle
  • Tampa Bay
  • Tennessee
  • Washington

2009

6 of 12 teams (bold) failed to make the playoffs the next season.

  • Arizona
  • Atlanta
  • Baltimore
  • Carolina
  • Indianapolis
  • Miami
  • Minnesota
  • NY Giants
  • Philadelphia
  • Pittsburgh
  • San Diego
  • Tennessee

2010

5 of 12 teams (bold) failed to make the playoffs the next season.

  • Arizona
  • Baltimore
  • Cincinnati
  • Dallas
  • Green Bay
  • Indianapolis
  • Minnesota
  • New England
  • New Orleans
  • NY Jets
  • Philadelphia
  • San Diego

2011

Who will miss the playoffs this season (you must pick at least 5)? My guesses are in italics – what are yours?

  • Atlanta
  • Baltimore
  • Chicago
  • Green Bay
  • Indianapolis
  • Kansas City
  • New England
  • New Orleans
  • NY Jets
  • Philadelphia
  • Pittsburgh
  • Seattle

I flipped a coin between Baltimore and Pittsburgh, went with Baltimore because they’ve made it 3 years in a row and that’s really hard to do. If Philly loses Vick for any period of time, they could be on the bubble as well. I’m curious to see how their all-star defense actually works out.

This post is part of the thread: NFL Playoff Predictions – an ongoing story on this site. View the thread timeline for more context on this post.

item.title: Feathers? Wire?
item.dc:creator: Alex
item.description: What the heck is Nike doing to college football uniforms? Feathers (or wings)? Wire? I can’t believe we’re seeing something worse than diamondplate. It’s one thing for the University of Nike Oregon to be a testing ground, but Florida too? Yikes, it’s spreading!
item.content:encoded:
What the heck is Nike doing to college football uniforms? Feathers (or wings)? Wire?

I can’t believe we’re seeing something worse than diamondplate. It’s one thing for the University of Nike Oregon to be a testing ground, but Florida too? Yikes, it’s spreading!

item.title: Camden Yards
item.dc:creator: Alex
item.description: My first game at Camden Yards became my first rainout at Camden Yards. The rain was definitely welcome as it had been a scorcher (97 degrees plus humidity) in Baltimore today. Along with the rain came some impressive wind and lightning. Camden Yards is an excellent ballpark – definitely recommended. It’s clearly the father of…
item.content:encoded:
My first game at Camden Yards

became my first rainout at Camden Yards.

The rain was definitely welcome as it had been a scorcher (97 degrees plus humidity) in Baltimore today. Along with the rain came some impressive wind and lightning.

Camden Yards is an excellent ballpark – definitely recommended. It’s clearly the father of the great new ballparks I’ve been to (Coors Field in Denver, Safeco Field in Seattle and formerly PacBell Park in San Francisco). Our seats were on the third base side letting us see the warehouse to right field and a bit of the Baltimore skyline to center field. The Orioles? Let’s say they’re still rebuilding…

item.title: All-Star Game
item.dc:creator: Alex
item.description: I think there are two reason why the baseball’s All-Star game has lost some of its shine. 1. Interleague play. Before interleague play the only time the best hitters and pitchers from each league faced each other was in the mid-summer classic and the World Series. Interleague play has cheapened that – it’s a shame.…
item.content:encoded:
I think there are two reason why the baseball’s All-Star game has lost some of its shine.

1. Interleague play. Before interleague play the only time the best hitters and pitchers from each league faced each other was in the mid-summer classic and the World Series. Interleague play has cheapened that – it’s a shame.

2. Television. When I was growing up as a baseball fan in the 80s and 90s in Seattle, I would rarely have a chance to see any Nation League games. Maybe I’d catch the Dodgers on another NL West team on the “game of the week”, but it was rare. Cable TV and the internet has changed all that. I probably get more Red Sox and Yankee news that I get about the Rockies (and my office is a few blocks from Coors Field).

And the home field advantage for the World Series is stupid all around, even if it is meaningless.

First post attempt from the BlackBerry app – forgot to post it earlier this week.
